title.narrative: Statistical support to Somalia phase II
Statistiskt stöd till Somalia fas II

description.narrative: Development objectives The overall development objective of this intervention is strengthened statistical capacity with the purpose of raising decision makers awareness, understanding and trust in statistical data. Expected results by the end of the intervention: 1) Statistical production: The Somali statistical authorities have improved the quality of statistical production in social and economic statistics 2) Statistical methodology: The general capacity in statistical methodology is improved and strengthened at the statistical departments 3) Communication and dissemination: Users have increased access to statistics data 4) Management: Planning and organisation of the statistical departments are improved The project proposal has a Theory of Change (ToC) following the logic below with some examples what is achieved at each level: Individual learning --> Institutional change --> Institutional effectiveness by increased access to data --> Increased level of awareness and trust in statistics by decision-makers --> Reaching country's development goals Individual learning - Staff is trained in different statistical areas (social, economic and environment), in methodology, communication, dissemination and management of statistics, this leads to Institutional change - when staff are trained and motivated statistical directorate and departments can develop realistic work plans for various statistical subject areas, this leads to Institutional effectiveness by increased access to data - Statistical departments, through their trained staff, have increased routines and capacity to produce and disseminate quality statistics, this leads to Increased level of awareness and trust in statistics by decision-makers - when the statistics produced and disseminated by statistics departments are recognised as of high quality it is used by decision makers for policy making and this leads to Reaching country's development goals - when using quality statistics, the country is able to better monitor the progress of the NDP and the SDGs and thus reaching and monitoring the country's development goals is enhanced.

SCB har ansökt till Sida om att få inleda en andra fas (2020 - 2022) av ett statistiksamarbete med det övergripande syftet att stärka kapaciteten hos statistikmyndigheterna i Somalia. Fas I löpte mellan 2015 och 2019 och denna andra fas syftar nu till att konsolidera och utveckla den kapacitet och kunskap som de deltagande somaliska myndigheterna förvärvade i den första fasen.
Detta kommer att ske genom att fortsätta stödja de somaliska statistikmyndigheterna. Projektets övergripande målsättning är således att:
Stärka den statistiska kapaciteten i Somalia i syfte att underlätta beslutsfattarnas medvetenhet, förståelse och förtroende för statistiska uppgifter.
Projektets förväntade resultat är:
1) Förbättrad kvalitet i framtagandet av social och ekonomisk statistik. 2) Förbättrad och förstärkt kapacitet bland personalen på statiskmyndigheterna inom statistisk metod. 3) Ökad tillgång till statistik och data med hög kvalitet. 4) Förbättrad och förstärkt planering och organisering av statistikmyndigheterna.
Denna andra fas förväntas stärka institutionell och teknisk kapacitet hos statistikbyrån i den federala regeringen i Somalia (FGS) och hos statistikbyrån i Puntland. Somaliland har varit en del av fas ett av denna insats och ambitionen är att åter få dem inkluderade under de kommande åren.

Statistics Sweden has applied to Sida to initiate a second phase (2020 - 2022) of a statistical collaboration with the overall aim of strengthening the capacity of the statistical authorities in Somalia. Phase I ran between 2015 and 2019 and this second phase is now aiming at consolidating and developing the capacity and knowledge acquired by the participating Somali authorities in the first phase.
This will be done by continuing to support the Somali statistical authorities. The overall objective of the project is thus to:
Strengthen the statistical capacity in Somalia in order to facilitate decision-makers' awareness, understanding and confidence in statistical data.
The project's expected results are:
1) Improved quality in the production of social and economic statistics. 2) Improved and strengthened capacity among the statistical authorities in the statistical method. 3) Increased access to high quality statistics and data. 4) Improved and strengthened planning and organization of the statistical authorities.
This second phase is expected to strengthen the institutional and technical capacity of the Statistics Office of the Federal Government of Somalia (FGS) and of the Statistics Office of Puntland. Somaliland has been part of phase I of this effort and the ambition is to have them included again in this second phase.

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

17.18 - By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts

17.18 - By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts.

17.19 - By 2030, build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development that complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity-building in developing countries

17.19 - By 2030, build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development that complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity-building in developing countries.

title.narrative: 12802 - Agreement on Contribution with Statistics Sweden

description.narrative:
Achievements and key activities during 2021:
1) Somalia Integrated Household Budget Survey (SIHBS)
Support was given to develop capacity at the Somalia Statistical Authorities in the household budget survey concept, including sample design, estimation and questionary design. The contribution also specifically supported the development of the sampling frame for the SIHBS. The design now provides a great balance between quality and budget (sample size) which is key to the final results of the survey.
2) Consumer Price Index (CPI)
The support from this contribution has contributed to an improved state of knowledge of harmonization in the context of price statistics as well as an improved understanding of the available means for working towards harmonization - organizational, legal and technical.
3) Gross Domestic Product (GDP)
The support focused on the update of the estimates of GDP compiled by the expenditure approach to include 2020 and revise 2018 and 2019. This was done for SNBS and Puntland while Somaliland did not participate.
4) Gender Statistics
The support continued the focus on the booklet Women and Men in Somalia with the near completion of the booklet for Puntland while a little more work remains for SNBS.
5) Financial support
The financial support to SNBS and the Puntland Statistics Department continued through the payments of trainees at the two organisations. This financial support improves the implementation and progress of the project activities.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
